teacheasy.mediahandler

Class ImageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.ImageHandler

  • public class ImageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles image objects on a page, including their addition and deletion as well as maintaining their state. Image objects are added by supplying the relevant data from the data structure. This class is used by the renderer when redrawing pages.
    Version:
    1.0 23 Feb 2015
    Author:
    Daniel Berhe, Jake Ransom

      • ImageHandler

        public ImageHandler(javafx.scene.Group nGroup)
        Constructor for the image handler.

    • Method Detail

      • insertImage

        public void insertImage(java.lang.String imageName,
               double locationX,
               double locationY,
               double widthSize,
               double heightSize,
               double rotationDegree,
               boolean scaleBased)
        Adds a new image to the group.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Name of the image as saved on disk.
        locationX - Desired x axis position of the image.
        locationY - Desired y axis position of the image.
        widthSize - Actual image width multiplier. Eg, size 2 is twice as big as the original image.
        heightSize - Actual image height multiplier.
        rotationDegree - Rotation of the image in degrees.
        scaleBased - Indicates if the size parameters are scale based or absolute.

      • getImage

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage(int imageID)
        Gets a specific image from the handler.
        Parameters:
        imageID - The ID of the image to get.
        Returns:
        The selected image object if it exists.

      • getImages

        public java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.image.ImageView> getImages()
        Gets the array list of image views.
        Returns:
        An array list of all the image views being handled.

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage(int imageID)
        Removes a specified image from the group.
        Parameters:
        imageID - The ID of the image to remove.

      • clearImages

        public void clearImages()
        Clear all the images.

      • debugPrint

        public void debugPrint()
        Prints information about the objects being handled to the console for debugging purposes.
